cleanDesc: Genuine BMW Front Brake Pad Set
short-description: These are the replacement FRONT brake pads that were used in the US F3X 335i/435i M Sport brake upgrade (option code S2NHA) and also used as the standard pad on Euro market 335i. Because all 335/435 front pads are the same size and shape this sport pad can be used as an upgrade for all 335 and 435 models, as well as any F30/F32 and F22 that has the M Performance brake upgrade.The S2NHA M Sport brakes were an option that could be added to any F30 during the ordering process (it is not unique to the M Sport trim package). The pads came from the Euro market 335i/435i and were a lot more aggressive than the standard F30 pads. They have a higher coefficient of friction and a lot of initial bite for immediate response and feel. These pads are considered a sport pad and intended for aggressive driving. Light pedal applications and easy braking will make them noisy. They also have more dust than the standard 335i pads. These are trade-offs for having a more capable pad.

cleanDesc: Brembo front Brake Pads - - F30 335i/iX, F32 435i/iX
short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific combination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. This item fits the following BMWs: 2012+ F30 BMW 335i 335iX - Sedan 2014+ F34 BMW 335iX - Gran Turismo 2014+ F32 BMW 435i 435iX - Coupe 2014+ F33 BMW 435i 435iX - Convertible

cleanDesc: Genuine BMW Brake Pads - E39 M5, E46 M3, Z4 M - Rear
short-description: These pads were originally equipped on the E39 M5, E46 M3, and Z4 M models. Owners of the E39 M5 and E46 M3 will know that the stock pads are already quite 'aggressive' from the factory with a lot of initial bite. The initial bite was built into the pad to stop criticism of BMW's lack of 'performance' brakes. Instead of building the M models with exotic - and expensive - multi-piston calipers, BMW engineers turned up the braking power in their pads. For the street, these are excellent brake pads with excellent feel and performance. The only downside is the dust that comes from an organic pad. The problem with many aftermarket and OEM pads is that they do not match the same level of initial bite as the stock OE BMW pads. This can make the brakes feel 'weak' and 'numb' even though the pads are working properly. If you want to maintain your braking feel, these are the best to use.   Although these pads were originally designed for M cars, they fit other models as well, making them a great first-step upgrade for better braking.   Price is for one set of pads - enough to replace the pads on both rear calipers.     1999-2006    330i 330ci 330xi M3  1997-2003    M5  2004-2010    525i -2/07  2004-2010    530i 530xi 528i 528xi 528i xDrive 535i 535xi 535i xDrive  1995-2001    740i 740il 750il  1990-1999    840i 840ci 850i 850ci 850csi  2004-2010    X3 2.5i X3 3.0i X3 3.0si  2000-2006    X5 3.0i X5 4.4i X5 4.6is X5 4.8is  2003-2008    Z4 M Roadster M Coupe  2000-2003    Z8 Roadster

cleanDesc: Hawk HP Plus Brake Pads - Front - E9X 335, E9X M3
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     2011+    1M Coupe  2008-2011   328i, 328Xi,  2007-2011   335i, 335Xi, 335d  2008-2011   M3  2004-2005   525i (automatic transmission only)  2006-2007   525i, 525xi (all transmissions)  2008-2010   528i, 528xi  2004-2007   530i, 530xi  2008-2010   535i, 535xi  2004-2010   545i, 550i  2004-2010   645Ci, 650Ci  2002-2008   745i, 745Li, 750i, 750Li, 760Li

cleanDesc:
Hawk DTC-30 Track/Race Brake Pads - Front - E9X 335, E9X M3
       ...
short-description: Hawk DTC-30 brake pads fill a spot between the entry-level HP Plus pads and an all-out race pad like the Hawk Blue or Pagid Orange. If you started out with HP Plus but feel like you are ready to advance to a more aggressive pad these are an excellent choice. The DTC-30 pads have greater torque output than an HP Plus and a very consistent torque curve which makes them more capable during hard track use than an HP Plus. These are intended for advanced users but should not be considered all-out race pads (unless used to balance brake bias).   The Hawk DTC (Dynamic Torque Control) compound offers the highest friction coefficients of any Hawk pad. The DTC pads offer high torque with aggressive and controllable initial bite, superior modulation and release characteristics, and excellent torque control. DTC-30 compound is often used as a replacement to Hawk Blue when more torque is wanted.

short-description: This REAR brake pad set is a direct replacement for the original BMW pads on the F30 320i/328iX, 328i/328iX, and the F32 428i/428iX. These pads are from the Original Equipment supplier to BMW (Textar, Pagid, Jurid, Bosch, etc) and will perform exactly like the pads that were originally installed on your car.   If you want your BMW to perform like it did when it left the factory the original-spec pads are the best option. These pads are from the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) that BMW used when they designed the car. These are the same pads that you would get from your local BMW dealer but at substantial savings. In fact, the pads in the BMW box will likely have a Textar, Pagid, or other OEM stamp! BMW will often use multiple manufacturers for their pads but all must meet the same original specification to be considered OEM. Why pay dealership prices when you don't have to? We offer performance brake pads or other alternatives that meet certain goals but when it's the original performance you're seeking, stick with the OEM brands.   Price is for a set of brake pads.     2014+    228i 228iX  2012+    320i 320iX 328i 328iX - Sedan  2012+    328i 328iX - Wagon  2014+    328i 328iX - Gran Turismo  2014+    428i 428iX - Coupe  2014+    428i 428iX - Convertible  2014+    428i 428iX - Gran Coupe

short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific combination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. cleanDesc: Hawk HP Plus Race Brake Pads - Rear - E38, E39, E46, E60, X3, X5, Z4...
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     2001-2006   330i 330Ci 330Xi  2001-2006   M3  1999-2004   M5  2007    525i  1995-2001   740i, 740i Sport, 740iL  2004-2010   X3 2.5i, X3 3.0i, X3 3.0si  1999-2006   X5 3.0i, X5 4.4i  2007-2008   Z4 M Roadster, Z4 M Coupe  2000-2003   Z8 Roadster

For the US market (up to 2014 model year) the M Sport Brake option gave you more aggressive pads on the stock calipers and rotors. This was the same pad used for the base 335 in Europe and features a more aggressive compound for a higher coefficient of friction and more initial bite. Although these pads dust more than the stock pads they provide much faster response and feel. These pads will be great for the enthusiast driver who wants a better pad for aggressive driving. However, if the car is used primarily for daily city driving, and brake dust is an aesthetic concern, then the stock pads will be a better option. cleanDesc: Hawk HP Plus Track/Street Brake Pads - Front - E36 (not M3), E46 (no...
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     1992-1999    (no M) including 318i, 318is, 325i, 325is, 328i, 328is & 323is  1999-2005    (no 330/M) including 323i, 323Ci, 325i, 325xi, 325Ci, 328i, 328Ci  1996-2002    (no M) including Z3 1.9, 2.3, 2.5, 2.8 & 3.0 liter  2003-2008    (no M or si) including Z4 2.5 & Z4 3.0 (no si!)

short-description: The RSL29 pad is an endurance racing compound with long life and great wear characteristics. It has stable friction over a broad temperature range which makes them a very easy to use and predictable braking pad in a lot of environments. cleanDesc: Brembo Front Brake Pads - E70 E71

OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. cleanDesc:
Hawk HP Plus Track/Street Brake Pads - Rear - E30 318, 325
        ...
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     1984-1991    318i 318is 318ic 325e 325es 325i 325ic 325is 325ix

cleanDesc: Hawk DTC-30 Track/Race Brake Pads - Front - E82 135
short-description: Hawk DTC-30 brake pads fill a spot between the entry-level HP Plus pads and an all-out race pad like the Hawk Blue or Pagid Orange. If you started out with HP Plus but feel like you are ready to advance to a more aggressive pad these are an excellent choice. The DTC-30 pads have greater torque output than an HP Plus and a very consistent torque curve which makes them more capable during hard track use than an HP Plus. These are intended for advanced users but should not be considered all-out race pads (unless used to balance brake bias).   The Hawk DTC (Dynamic Torque Control) compound offers the highest friction coefficients of any Hawk pad. The DTC pads offer high torque with aggressive and controllable initial bite, superior modulation and release characteristics, and excellent torque control. DTC-30 compound is often used as a replacement to Hawk Blue when more torque is wanted.

Brembo Rear Brake Pad set - E38
short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific combination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy. Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. We highly recommend you replace the brake sensor wire, sold separately, with the pads to ensure proper operation of your brake pad thickness warning light system.

Hawk HP Plus Brake Pads - Front - E46 330/M3, X3, Z4, Z4 M
        ...
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     2001-2005    330i 330Ci 330xi  2003-2006    M3  2004-2010    X3 2.5i X3 3.0i X3 3.0si  2006-2008    Z4 3.0si  2003-2009    M Roadster & M Coupe (S54)

cleanDesc: Brake Pad Set
Hawk HPS 5.0 Street Sport Brake Pads - Front
short-description: A high-performance street pad with much-improved braking performance and without the levels of dust from a factory pad. The Street 5.0 pads are perfect for drivers who don’t want an ordinary replacement pad and want something that will hold up during aggressive street driving. The Street 5.0 pads are similar to the established Hawk HPS pads but with more initial bite. While the HPS pads fill the need of a direct replacement OEM-type pad, the Street 5.0 kicks braking performance into the next gear. With the Street 5.0 pads you can expect: Better stopping power even when the pads are cold Good initial bite (more than on Hawk HPS) Excellent resistance to fade during street use Moderate dust during normal street driving Quiet operation Easy on rotors This pad set includes pads for both Front brakes.

cleanDesc: StopTech Street Performance Brake Pads - Rear - E82 128, E90/E92 325...
short-description: StopTech Street Performance rear brake pads are designed for high-performance street drivers who want a high-quality and capable pad that won't break the wallet. These pads feature an innovative composite compound that is quiet, great bite and modulation, low fade under hard street-type use (and autocross, light track). We've tried these pads and love how capable they were when used hard but also how easy they were for regular stop-and-go driving. This might be the last brake pad you will ever need! cleanDesc: OEM Pagid Front Brake Pads (Euro Compound) - F02, F06, F07, F10, F13...
short-description: These are the stock OEM pads for most F02 7-series, F06/F12/F13 6-series, and F07/F10 5-series. This part number was used mainly in Europe and is a slightly more aggressive compound than what BMW used on US market cars. All of the other brake components are the same for US and Euro but the pad stands up better for high speed driving. Because of the more aggressive material some added brake noise is to be expected. It is interchangable with BMW #34116793021, which is the US pad compound. Note these pads also came with the rare "High Speed Brakes" option (code S5AE) on the 528i/535i but will not fit the standard 528i/535i brakes.   These are the OEM front brake pads. BMW used several different suppliers for their brake pads and we buy direct from their distributors to get you the same pad as originally equipped but at a fraction of the cost of the local BMW dealer. OEM brands include Pagid, Textar, Jurid, Ate, and others. These are the same pads as what originally came on your car but without the expensive BMW logo.     2010+    535i GT, 535i xDrive GT, 550i GT, 550i xDrive GT  2011+    528i 535i    2011+    550i 550i xDrive  2012+    650i Gran Coupe  2012+    650i 650i xDrive  2009+   740i 740li 750i 750li 750i xDrive 750li xDrive

cleanDesc: Brembo Front Brake Pads - E70 X5M, E71 X6M
short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific combination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. We highly recommend you replace the brake sensor wire, sold separately, with the pads to ensure proper operation of your brake pad thickness warning light system.

cleanDesc:
Hawk HP Plus Street Brake Pads - Front - E60, E82, E89, E9X
       ...
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     2004-2005 E60    sedan (manual transmission only)  2007-2011 E82/E88    coupe, convertible  2006-2010 E90    sedan (Canadian market model)  2006 E90    sedan  2007 E9X    sedan, coupe, convertible, wagon  2006 E90    sedan  2009-current E89    Roadster

cleanDesc: Hawk HT-10 For StopTech ST-22 caliper
Hawk DTC-30 Track/Race Brake Pads - Rear - E82 135
short-description: Hawk DTC-30 brake pads fill a spot between the entry-level HP Plus pads and an all-out race pad like the Hawk Blue or Pagid Orange. If you started out with HP Plus but feel like you are ready to advance to a more aggressive pad these are an excellent choice. The DTC-30 pads have greater torque output than an HP Plus and a very consistent torque curve which makes them more capable during hard track use than an HP Plus. These are intended for advanced users but should not be considered all-out race pads (unless used to balance brake bias).   The Hawk DTC (Dynamic Torque Control) compound offers the highest friction coefficients of any Hawk pad. The DTC pads offer high torque with aggressive and controllable initial bite, superior modulation and release characteristics, and excellent torque control. DTC-30 compound is often used as a replacement to Hawk Blue when more torque is wanted.

short-description: The RSL29 pad is an endurance racing compound with long life and great wear characteristics. It has stable friction over a broad temperature range which makes them a very easy to use and predictable braking pad in a lot of environments. An evolution of the RSL19 endurance pad designed for more advanced drivers. This compound combines the outstanding wear rate of the RSL19 with a slightly higher coefficient of friction and initial bite. RSL29 also features improved hot fade resistance over the RSL19. In addition to the endurance racing, this pad will also be found in GT and VLN classes and Touring Cars (including our own E46 World Challenge cars). BMW has been using Pagid Yellow pads on their Nurburgring test vehicles and Ring Taxi for years. Brembo Rear Brake Pads - F22/23 228i, F3X 320/328 428
short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific com bination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. We highly recommend you replace the brake sensor wire, sold separately, with the pads to ensure proper operation of your brake pad thickness warning light system.

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RSL19 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Front - E9X M3, E60...
short-description: RSL19 A favorite of BMW's Motorsport engineers, the Pagid RSL19 compound is an endurance pad based on the RS14 Black but with less friction to improve modulation and low pedal effort. These pads work best in a heat range up to 1,100* F. The combination of friction levels, fade stability, and long life for pads and rotors makes this a favorite for club and HPDE drivers.

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RSL1 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Front - E9X M3, E60,...
short-description: The latest in the Yellow line takes all of the RSL29 characteristics and adds a bit more aggressive behavior. Friction levels go up for more initial bite and better fade resistance. Modulation and release stays close to RSL29 levels. Pad and rotor wear is a little more than on the previous Yellows but still within reasonable levels and the RSL1 is still considered an extended endurance pad. Its development stemming from GT classes at Le Mans and Nürburgring.Since Pagid pads tend to "out-gas" we recommend using these pads with a new gas-slotted or cross-drilled rotor for the best performance. Pagid brake pads are not compatible with previously used rotors, especially if used with a carbon or Kevlar based race pad.

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RSL29 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Rear - E9X M3, E60 ...
short-description: The RSL29 pad is an endurance racing compound with long life and great wear characteristics. It has stable friction over a broad temperature range which makes them a very easy to use and predictable braking pad in a lot of environments. An evolution of the RSL19 endurance pad designed for more advanced drivers. This compound combines the outstanding wear rate of the RSL19 with a slightly higher coefficient of friction and initial bite. RSL29 also features improved hot fade resistance over the RSL19. In addition to the endurance racing, this pad will also be found in GT and VLN classes and Touring Cars (including our own E46 World Challenge cars). BMW has been using Pagid Yellow pads on their Nurburgring test vehicles and Ring Taxi for years.This is the set of Rear pads.

cleanDesc: Centric Posi Quiet Brake Pads - Rear - F22 M235i, F30 335i, F32 435i...
short-description: Centric Posi Quiet Brake pads surpass the braking performance of stock pads but do it with far less dust. This semi-metallic pad compound is very easy to use on the street with excellent feel and initial bite and low noise. But the best thing we like with these pads is how little dust they produce. You will be amazed at how little dust there is on your wheels after a week of use. These are a great replacement pad for fans of the discontinued PBR Metal Master Pads.These pads fit the standard brakes that came on the 2014+ M Sport brake upgrade (with blue calipers) and the M Performance brake package on the F22 2-series, F30 3-series, and F32 4-series. The M Sport brake upgrade was offered as a stand-alone option and consisted of larger rotors and a 2-piston Brembo rear caliper. The front and rear calipers were blue with the ///M logo. The M Performance brakes were a dealer-installed accessory option and came in red, orange, or yellow/gold caliper colors.There are many variations of F30 brake packages so we encourage every F30 owner to visit our brake FAQ pages -

short-description: The latest in the Yellow line takes all of the RSL29 characteristics and adds a bit more aggressive behavior. Friction levels go up for more initial bite and better fade resistance. Modulation and release stays close to RSL29 levels. Pad and rotor wear is a little more than on the previous Yellows but still within reasonable levels and the RSL1 is still considered an extended endurance pad. Its development stemming from GT classes at Le Mans and Nürburgring.Since Pagid pads tend to "out-gas" we recommend using these pads with a new gas-slotted or cross-drilled rotor for the best performance. Pagid brake pads are not compatible with previously used rotors, especially if used with a carbon or Kevlar based race pad.

cleanDesc: Hawk HP Plus Brake Pads - Front - F22/F3X 228/328/428
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     2014+    228i 228iX  2012+    320i 320iX 328i 328iX - Sedan  2012+    328i 328iX - Wagon  2014+    328i 328iX - Gran Turismo  2014+    428i 428iX - Coupe  2014+    428i 428iX - Convertible  2014+    428i 428iX - Gran Coupe

short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific combination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. Includes brake sensor wire.

short-description: This REAR brake pad set is a direct replacement for the original standard BMW pads on the F30 335i/iX and the F32 435i/iX (not for M Sport brakes). These pads are from the Original Equipment supplier to BMW (Textar, Pagid, Jurid, Bosch, etc) and will perform exactly like the pads that were originally installed on your car.   If you want your BMW to perform like it did when it left the factory the original-spec pads are the best option. These pads are from the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) that BMW used when they designed the car. These are the same pads that you would get from your local BMW dealer but at substantial savings. In fact, the pads in the BMW box will likely have a Textar, Pagid, or other OEM stamp! BMW will often use multiple manufacturers for their pads but all must meet the same original specification to be considered OEM. Why pay dealership prices when you don't have to? We offer performance brake pads or other alternatives that meet certain goals but when it's the original performance you're seeking, stick with the OEM brands.   Price is for a set of brake pads.     2012+    335i 335iX - Sedan  2014+    335iX - Gran Turismo  2014+    435i 435iX - Coupe  2014+    435i 435iX - Convertible  2014+    435i 435iX - Gran CoupeThis REAR brake pad set is a direct replacement for the original standard BMW pads on the F30 335i/iX and the F32 435i/iX (not for M Sport brakes). Brembo Front Brake Pads - E46 330i/ci/xi
short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific combination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. We highly recommend you replace the brake sensor wire, sold separately, with the pads to ensure proper operation of your brake pad thickness warning light system.

short-description: The RSL29 pad is an endurance racing compound with long life and great wear characteristics. It has stable friction over a broad temperature range which makes them a very easy to use and predictable braking pad in a lot of environments. An evolution of the RSL19 endurance pad designed for more advanced drivers. This compound combines the outstanding wear rate of the RSL19 with a slightly higher coefficient of friction and initial bite. RSL29 also features improved hot fade resistance over the RSL19. In addition to the endurance racing, this pad will also be found in GT and VLN classes and Touring Cars (including our own E46 World Challenge cars). BMW has been using Pagid Yellow pads on their Nurburgring test vehicles and Ring Taxi for years. cleanDesc: Front Street/Sport Brake Pad Set - JCW
Hawk HP Plus Brake Pads - Rear - E89 Z4 30i/35i/35is
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     2009+    Z4 30i 35i 35is

cleanDesc: EBC GreenStuff Premium Brake Pad Set JCW
Hawk HP Plus Track/Street Brake Pads - Rear - E31
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     1991-1997   840i, 840Ci, 850i, 850Ci, 850CSi coupe

cleanDesc: Pagid S Sport Pads - Rear - E82/E88 135i
short-description: Pagid's "S" Sport pads are a step above your typical street performance pad. These pads were originally developed as the OEM stock pad for many supercar manufacturers such as Ferrari and Bugatti. The requirements for those applications make these an ideal pad for BMW enthusiasts too! Although pricier than regular street pads the Pagid Sport pads return phenomenal performance and rave reviews. These pads are intended for heavy and aggressive street braking or mild open track lapping. We consider these to be 'dual purpose pads' that can be driven every day but also used occasionally on the track*. Even though street use is acceptable these pads work best when they have a little bit of heat in them.  * - These can be used as a track pad, however, care must be taken not to overheat them for prolonged periods. Track conditions and driver experience levels may dictate a more serious track pad.     2008-2013    135i

cleanDesc:
Hawk HP Plus Track/Street Brake Pads - Front - E30 318/325
        ...
short-description: Hawk's HP Plus pads fill the need for a "dual-purpose" pad - offering acceptable street performance that also holds up well on the racetrack. The beauty of these pads is that you can put them on at home or your shop and use them to drive to and from the track, with a full day of on-track driving in between. While these track pads actually do work on the street, noticeable increases in noise, dust, and brake wear are to be expected. These pads are great for the weekend track junkie who wants exceptional street performance while also having a capable pad on the track. They are excellent for novice and first-time drivers while also being a favorite of instructors too. And they are inexpensive compared to most full race pads.   These are not all-out racing pads, however, and they work best when used within their temperature range (100-800*F). Higher friction levels and brake temps will increase wear, especially on heavier cars. Brake cooling kits are strongly recommended. If you find these pads are not lasting, or you are exceeding their performance capability, it will be time to step into a full, dedicated track/racing pad.     1984-1991    318i 318is 318ic 325e 325es 325i 325ic 325is 325ix

short-description: The Hawk HT14 compound is one of the most aggressive race pads in the Hawk catalog. Like the Hawk Blue race pads, these have a very high torque capability combined with an aggressive initial bite. Modulation and release remain excellent but these pads work best under elevated temperatures. They are excellent for ultra fast deceleration rates like you would have using a high downforce setup in sprint races.     + very high torque performance  + high temp range  + up to 1300*F  + high abrasive metallic content  + excellent modulation at high temps     2001-2005    330i 330Ci 330xi  2003-2006    M3  2004-2010    X3 2.5i X3 3.0i X3 3.0si  2006-2008    Z4 3.0si  2003-2009    M Roadster & M Coupe (S54)

short-description: A high-performance street pad with much-improved braking performance and without the levels of dust from a factory pad. The Street 5.0 pads are perfect for drivers who don’t want an ordinary replacement pad and want something that will hold up during aggressive street driving. The Street 5.0 pads are similar to the established Hawk HPS pads but with more initial bite. While the HPS pads fill the need of a direct replacement OEM-type pad, the Street 5.0 kicks braking performance into the next gear. With the Street 5.0 pads you can expect: Better stopping power even when the pads are cold Good initial bite (more than on Hawk HPS) Excellent resistance to fade during street use Moderate dust during normal street driving Quiet operation Easy on rotors

Hawk Street Race Brake Pads - Rear - F3X 328i/330i 335i/340i 428i/43...
short-description: Hawk Performance has dominated motorsport race tracks since 1990, offering highly-engineered friction products for nearly every type of racing. The DTC (Dynamic Torque Control) pads offer high torque with aggressive controllable initial bite and superior release and torque control characteristics. The Street/Race pads are modeled after the intermediate DTC-30 track pads but include additional features that make them more street-friendly. The coefficient of friction and operating temp make them a very serious track pad - more aggressive than a Hawk HP Plus but still a couple of steps down from what a true competitive racecar would be using. They fall right into that sweet spot where a driver has surpassed the HP Plus performance but is not quite ready for all-out race pads. This will be more user-friendly to advanced drivers who are moving up the performance ladder at track events and HPDE.Hawk StreetRace Features:

short-description: Pagid's "S" Sport pads are a step above your typical street performance pad. These pads were originally developed as the OEM stock pad for many supercar manufacturers such as Ferrari and Bugatti. The requirements for those applications make these an ideal pad for BMW enthusiasts too! Although pricier than regular street pads the Pagid Sport pads return phenomenal performance and rave reviews. These pads are intended for heavy and aggressive street braking or mild open track lapping. We consider these to be 'dual purpose pads' that can be driven every day but also used occassionlly on the track*. Even though street use is acceptable these pads work best when they have a little bit of heat in them.  * - These can be used as a track pad, however, care must be taken not to overheat them for prolonged periods. cleanDesc: Brembo front Brake Pads - E30
short-description: Brembo brake pads are the result of years of experience and collaboration with the world's leading carmakers. Specifically designed for the North American market, these Brembo replacement pads offer a terrific combination of performance, comfort, reliability, and longevity. Ceramic material provides better braking performance, minimized noise, and a noticeable reduction in brake dust. OE equivalent friction formulations are specifically engineered to enhance braking power, minimize braking distances and provide quiet, safe braking in all road conditions. Brembo pads are thermal scorched to minimize break in period and reduce fading. Direct molding pressing guarantees maximum product accuracy Underlayer provides noise dampening and reduces heat transfer to the caliper. Brembo multi-layer ESE shim ( Elastomer-Steel-Elastomer ) minimizes vibrations and noise. Brembo pads and shoes are homologated in compliance with ECE-R90 legislation and are marked accordingly for easy identification. Includes brake sensor wire.

Pagid Racing RSL29 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Rear - E9X Non-M
 ...
short-description: The RSL29 pad is an endurance racing compound with long life and great wear characteristics. It has stable friction over a broad temperature range which makes them a very easy to use and predictable braking pad in a lot of environments. An evolution of the RSL19 endurance pad designed for more advanced drivers. This compound combines the outstanding wear rate of the RSL19 with a slightly higher coefficient of friction and initial bite. RSL29 also features improved hot fade resistance over the RSL19. In addition to the endurance racing, this pad will also be found in GT and VLN classes and Touring Cars (including our own E46 World Challenge cars). BMW has been using Pagid Yellow pads on their Nurburgring test vehicles and Ring Taxi for years.   This is the set of REAR pads.     2006-2013    Non-M Chassis

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RS14 Blue Allround Racing Brake Pad Set - Front - E36 M...
short-description: Pagid Racing RS Allround Blue brake pads are an exceptional pad for nearly any racing application. The main features of these pads include consistent in-stop behavior with good pedal feedback, excellent release characteristics, low heat conductivity, decent disc  wear rate, and easy bedding. These pads shine best in scenarios when working under high heat applications, thanks to their high fade resistance and modulation. Their are three variations of the RS pads, all with slightly different characteristics.

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RST1 Rally/Sprint/Stock Car Racing Brake Pads - Front -...
short-description: Pagid's newest sprint racing pad was developed for racing cars achieving very high average speeds with short braking distances and functional aero. The RST pads feature very high friction levels for the quickest bite and highest fade resistance than any other Pagid pad. RST pads are broken into 5 levels and all have ranging bite and release characteristics. RST pads will trade low wear for torque output and faster response. These were developed based on the needs of race engineers in World Challenge, Daytona Prototype, and GTLM where functional aero meant high grip in the corners and smaller braking zones.

If you have converted your rotors to a ceramic composite style, then performance brake pad options are now available from Pagid Racing. These were developed based on the needs of race engineers in World Challenge, Daytona Prototype, and GTLM where functional aero meant high grip in the corners and smaller braking zones.

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RSL1 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Rear - E46 E39 E38 E...
short-description: The latest in the Yellow line takes all of the RSL29 characteristics and adds a bit more aggressive behavior. Friction levels go up for more initial bite and better fade resistance. Modulation and release stays close to RSL29 levels. Pad and rotor wear is a little more than on the previous Yellows but still within reasonable levels and the RSL1 is still considered an extended endurance pad. Its development stemming from GT classes at Le Mans and Nürburgring.Since Pagid pads tend to "out-gas" we recommend using these pads with a new gas-slotted or cross-drilled rotor for the best performance. Pagid brake pads are not compatible with previously used rotors, especially if used with a carbon or Kevlar based race pad.

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RSL29 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Front - M3 Evo 1 &a...
short-description: The RSL29 pad is an endurance racing compound with long life and great wear characteristics. It has stable friction over a broad temperature range which makes them a very easy to use and predictable braking pad in a lot of environments. An evolution of the RSL19 endurance pad designed for more advanced drivers. This compound combines the outstanding wear rate of the RSL19 with a slightly higher coefficient of friction and initial bite. RSL29 also features improved hot fade resistance over the RSL19. In addition to the endurance racing, this pad will also be found in GT and VLN classes and Touring Cars (including our own E46 World Challenge cars). BMW has been using Pagid Yellow pads on their Nurburgring test vehicles and Ring Taxi for years.   This is the set of FRONT pads.     1988-1991    M3

cleanDesc: MTC Brake Pad Sensor (Overall Length 840 mm) - E36 Z3
short-description: Your brake pad wear sensors send the signal to your dashboard alert light when the pads start to wear thin. This keeps your rotors in good shape and prevents premature wear from over-worn pads. When it comes time to replace your brake pads, make sure you have the proper sensors for replacement. This replacement brake pad sensor is the perfect compliment to new pads. Some pads do not come with sensors, so a replacement brake pad wear sensor is needed. Replace all of your pads and sensors to give your braking like-new performance. A quality part from MTC offers you a budget friendly replacement. If it's time to replace your pads and sensors, then you should also replace your rotors to get maximum braking performance. With a new pad and rotor set on your vehicle, stopping will be completely restored. Enjoy the stopping you liked when you first obtained your vehicle. With new pads and rotors, you need to make sure they are bedded and mated with each other. Check online for the proper bedding procedure to ensure long life and quality braking.

ABS Speed Sensor
short-description: ABS (Antilock Brake System) wheel speed sensors tell the ABS controller when wheels lose traction and lock up during braking. Individual sensors at each wheel are sometimes damaged by road hazards, and may also fail electrically from heat and vibration. A failed sensor turns on the ABS warning light, and disables ABS operation until the fault is repaired.

cleanDesc: Pagid Racing RSL29 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Rear - G20 M340, G2...
short-description: The RSL29 pad is an endurance racing compound with long life and great wear characteristics. It has stable friction over a broad temperature range which makes them a very easy to use and predictable braking pad in a lot of environments. An evolution of the RSL19 endurance pad designed for more advanced drivers. This compound combines the outstanding wear rate of the RSL19 with a slightly higher coefficient of friction and initial bite. RSL29 also features improved hot fade resistance over the RSL19. In addition to the endurance racing, this pad will also be found in GT and VLN classes and Touring Cars (including our own E46 World Challenge cars). BMW has been using Pagid Yellow pads on their Nurburgring test vehicles and Ring Taxi for years. Features: Medium Friction Coefficient Race Formula Long Pad and Rotor Life Easy Bedding High-Temperature Range Always bed brake pads before use.

cleanDesc: Cool Carbon Street Sport Pad Set - Front - E82 135i
short-description: Cool Carbon S/T brake pads have excellent stopping power and feel with low levels of dust and noise. Engineered for European cars with high speed development on the Autobahn, Cool Carbon is a sporty compound intended for every day use. The S/T compound has more stopping power and initial bite than stock thanks to a higher coefficient of friction and composite materials. We are big fans of these as a sporty street pad and recommend them for medium-aggressive street driving and autocross.

cleanDesc: World Brake Resource Parking Brake Shoe Set - E10
Pagid Racing RSL1 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Front - E36 M3, E46 ...
short-description: The latest in the Yellow line takes all of the RSL29 characteristics and adds a bit more aggressive behavior. Friction levels go up for more initial bite and better fade resistance. Modulation and release stays close to RSL29 levels. Pad and rotor wear is a little more than on the previous Yellows but still within reasonable levels and the RSL1 is still considered an extended endurance pad. Its development stemming from GT classes at Le Mans and Nürburgring.Since Pagid pads tend to "out-gas" we recommend using these pads with a new gas-slotted or cross-drilled rotor for the best performance. Pagid brake pads are not compatible with previously used rotors, especially if used with a carbon or Kevlar based race pad.

cleanDesc: Centric Posi Quiet Brake Pads - Front - F10 528i/xi
short-description: Centric Posi Quiet Brake pads surpass the braking performance of stock pads but do it with far less dust. This semi-metallic pad compound is very easy to use on the street with excellent feel and initial bite and low noise. But the best thing we like with these pads is how little dust they produce. You will be amazed at how little dust there is on your wheels after a week of use. These are a great replacement pad for fans of the discontinued PBR Metal Master Pads.

cleanDesc: Rear Brake Pad Sensor - Priced Each
Pagid RSL19 Endurance Racing Brake Pads - Front - E39, E31, E38, E53...
short-description: Pagid's classic compound for endurance racing on the basis of the RS 14. A slight reduction of the friction value improves the modulation (controllability). Constant temperatures up to 600C (1.100F) are possible. The combination of friction value, fading stability and low wear rateson pads and discs (rotors) realized with this pad compound is unmatched up to now. Due to its outstanding wear rate and driveability, PAGID endurancematerials are often used at sprint races. A multiple winner of Daytona 24h, Le Mans 24h, Sebring 12h, Spa 24 h, Nurburgring 24h, often with no pad change and usually no disc (rotor) change.   Since Pagid pads tend to "out-gas" we recommend using these pads with a new gas-slotted or cross-drilled rotor for the best performance. Pagid brakepads are not compatible with previously used rotors, especially if used with a carbon or Kevlar based race pad.     1991-1997    850i, 850Ci, 850CSi  1995-2001    740i, 740iS, 740iL  1997-2003    530i, 540i sedan, 540iT wagon, M5  1999-2006    X5 3.0i, X5 4.4i
